column4: is it just me or is squashfs on most livecd distro's not long term stable?
seems after a while on any box you start getting squashfs errors
and the system collapses
days to weeks
I saved some of the log I think
it was hard,
syslog and messages hit 330 meg and killed up the filesystem
cause I been debating
fedora 9 pissed me off
switch back to windows 95?
it's a bug in their detection routines
I think it's setting the dvi port when the crt is on vga
etc
I was walking newbies thru kernel compiles long distance over the phone before ubuntu was even a concept runt
so save the smart ass arrogant "oh you are too stupid to use linux" comments for someone else
and yet .. your in here playing the "it doesnt work out of the box" card?
actually
it's ubuntu specific
the card has been supported by stock xfree86 and x.org for yrs
what bug number is it again?
in basic 2d mode
it's only in ubuntu do I see this behavior
as for you n8tuser  I am not bitching, I am asking if anyone else seen this behavior
What ubuntu bug number did you file the problem and fix under?
